intro: Erica manipuliflora subsp. anthura, commonly known as the purple heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to deep purple, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Erica manipuliflora subsp. anthura is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging climates.
